column5: It would be just under $3k to do that at Obabikon, but would depend on the dates.

Jared, sorry I didn't stop in and book that early Pike trip. Just wasn't sure about ice out. If it happens I will check in and see if you have anything available. Hope you are having a good show in Mpls!!
Thompson is more like 900 km north of Winnipeg.
No problem at all. Ice is certainly going to be late this year. I'm going to guess our area will be out around May 9th. Which is VERY close to late records.

I have stayed as a single fisherman at lodge 88 on Esnagi Lake a few years ago. I wasn't charged extra, and had a guide. As I recall his name was Bob and he was a great guide. Outstanding facilities and meals and the fishing was very, very good. It was well below your price range and is worth a look. It was a great value
Flying solo this summer, looking for a fully guided 7 day trip in NW Ontario or Manitoba, Prefer under $3000
Haven't looked up the price, so it is a gut reaction answer. Check out Silver Water Wheel Lodge. PjShorthorn
for 3k it will be tough to get a fully guided trip for 1 person...id shoot mike borger a pm are you looking for american plan or housekeeping?what species of fish?
If you're after Trophy Pike, Hearst Air might be worth a look:https://www.hearstair.com/trophy-angling/

Hey - That is a tough price point esp if you are planning to fish alone. I have looked for the exact same thing and the best I could do was closer to $4000 without an uncharge for being alone. One place that does fit the bill is Dunlop's Fly-in Lodge. It is under $3000 / Fly in / Guided / and he has a cabin for guys fishing alone. The issue is he flies out of Thompson MB. That is around 500km north of Winnipeg. So you either need to add a day to drive up / back or fly up which adds about $500 or so and then you are over your 3k target. If you find a good options please post back where you decided to go. Brett
check out stormer lake lodge , north of red lake, great fishing and great meals guides are available.
thats good advice...have you stayed there?
ive heard great things about esnagami lodge.....american plan is $1890 cad,and i believe they offer guiding
Yes. I stayed at Dunlops in 2017 and I have a return planned for 19. If you would like more info feel free to PM me.
